item.title: Witcher 3 Online Mod Lets You Play the Entire Campaign With Friends
item.content:encoded:
A new multiplayer mod for The Witcher 3, called ‘Witcher Online’, lets players complete the entire campaign with their friends.

There appears to be a lot happening with the Witcher franchise. Reports suggest that a new DLC is set to arrive by May 2026, and the next installment is also in development. However, it seems we have a long wait ahead before these releases become available. In the meantime, players can explore a mod that significantly enhances the original game’s replayability.

The Witcher Online Mod Features Customization, Emotes, and Full Campaign Experience

Spotted by PCGamesN, a new mod for The Witcher 3 has surfaced on NexusMods called Witcher Online. The mod adds multiplayer to the title, allowing players to play through the entire story with their friends. The mod features chat functionality for conversations with strangers, along with emotes to express yourself even more.

The Witcher Online Mode can be combined with the Custom Player Characters mod to add more customisation, and the Chill Out mod just to have a relaxing time in the taverns with your friends. Check out the The Witcher 3 multiplayer mod in action in the video below:

Players will need a non-pirated next-gen version of The Witcher 3, version 4.04 or higher. It can be purchased through Steam or GOG.

The Witcher 3 is known for having some of the best choice-driven narrative campaigns, a wealth of high-quality side quests, and some of the most intriguing characters. It is a wonderful experience on your own, which will only be enhanced once your friends join in on the fun.

In other news, The Witcher 3’s rumoured expansion could take players to a new region. Additionally, Netflix’s live-action series will end in 2026. What are your thoughts on the Witcher Online mod? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about an insider reaffirming that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is still coming to Xbox in 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Cairn Release Date & Exact Start Time
item.content:encoded:
Cairn is set to be one of the biggest indie releases of 2026, with the title surging past 700,000 wishlists last year, and the wait for the release date is rapidly approaching a conclusion.

The climbing title has garnered plenty of interest already and is expected to surge in popularity to hit a fresh summit when it launches on PC and PlayStation 5.

If you’re counting down the hours until you can jump in, Insider Gaming has all the release date and start time details for Cairn.

When Does Cairn Release?

Cairn has an official release date of January 29, but the exact date will vary depending on your platform and your location in the world.

Some players will be able to play on the evening of January 28, while others will have to wait until the early hours of the morning on January 30, as developer The Game Bakers has opted for a simultaneous worldwide release. However, the release times are different on each platform.

What Time Does Cairn Release?

Cairn will be available worldwide at 9 AM PT on January 29 on Steam, but players on PlayStation 5 look set to be able to jump in hours earlier.

The start time details come from SteamDB, showing that the exact time of day for the release with vary depending on where they are located in the world. As such, while the release date is officially January 29, players in some regions won’t be able to jump in until the early hours of the morning of January 30.

It’s a different story on PlayStation 5, however, as the PlayStation Store states a release time of 9 PM PT on January 28 on the platform, 12 hours ahead of the Steam release. Should these times change, this article will be updated.

The table below shows the exact start time and release date for Ciarn in major time zones across the world.

Are you excited for the release of Cairn? Share your thoughts on the game in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, find out all the release date details for Echoes of Elysium, and take a look at all the active codes to redeem in Arknights: Enfield.

item.title: Arknights: Endfield Preload Guide & File Sizes Explained
item.content:encoded:
The action is waiting for you in Arknights: Endfield. But you can’t prepare for it unless you preload Arknights: Endfield, and to do that, you also need to know its file sizes across PlayStation, PC, and more.

The End(field) wait is nigh. A new Arknights will burst onto the scene shortly, and it is a huge push in a different direction for the franchise. No longer is tower defense at the forefront of the core gameplay system, as Endfield has evolved and exploded into life with action and RPG flourishes. If you’re one of the many eager to dive, find out how to preload now.

How To Download & Preload Arknights: Endfield

You can preload Arknights: Endfield across mobile, PlayStation, and PC, and it requires you to buy and download the game from the respective game storefronts.

Here’s a quick rundown on how to download Endfield across its various platforms.

How To Preload Arknights: Endfield On Mobile (Android & Apple)

  1. Go to the Google Play page on Android or the App Store page on Apple.
  2. Search for Arknights: Endfield.
  3. Confirm your purchase.
  4. Launch the Arknights: Endfield application once it’s installed.
  5. Create or log in to your Gryphline account.
  6. Now, you can predownload Arknights: Endfield!

How To Preload Arknights: Endfield On PC (Windows & Epic Games Store)

  1. Visit the official Arknights: Endfield website.
  2. Click on either Windows or the Epic Games Store in the bottom-right corner.
  3. Download the Arknights: Endfield launcher.
  4. Once it’s installed, you can preload the game.
  5. When it’s ready, you can play Endfield the second it goes live—find out Arknights: Endfield’s release date and start times.

How To Preload Arknights: Endfield On PS5

  1. Make your way to the PS5 store.
  2. Use the search function to find Arknights: Endfield.
  3. Click on the game.
  4. Buy and download Arknights: Endfield.
  5. Preload the game once it’s ready.

Arknights: Endfield File Sizes on PlayStation, Xbox & PC, Explained

The file sizes for Arknights: Endfield range from anywhere between 22 GB to 78 GB, depending on which platform you want to play on.

Below, we’ve listed all four major platforms Arknights: Endfield is available on, and this will be updated if additional ports arrive on Xbox or Nintendo Switch after launch.

These seem like reasonable enough download sizes. Aside from the ever-unpredictable PC unpacking size, it’s all between 20-40 GB for what looks like a fairly meaty game. Message the Insider Gaming Discord Server with your thoughts on the game and if you’ve been able to play it already.

We have plenty of other helpful tidbits answering top Endfield questions, such as is Arknights: Endfield on Xbox Game Pass, and all Arknights: Endfield Codes and how to redeem them

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth Still Coming to Xbox in 2026, Insider Reaffirms
item.content:encoded:
A reliable insider has reaffirmed that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth will release for Xbox in 2026.

For those unaware, back in September 2025, it was claimed that Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth would release for Xbox and the Switch 2 in 2026. We have yet to receive any official confirmation from either Xbox or Square Enix, but the insider seems confident it will release this year.

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth for Xbox is Coming this Year

The insider who has reaffirmed the release for Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth on Xbox is none other than NateTheHate. Interestingly, the reconfirmation comes via the insider’s latest X post (formerly Twitter), where he thanked the community for dubbing him r/GamingLeaksAndRumour’s Leaker of the Year.

In one of the comments, NateTheHate was asked whether the plans for Rebirth coming to Xbox in 2026 are still the same, to which he responded, “Yes.” NateTheHate also stated that leaking something about Half-Life 3 is something he will “try to achieve” this year. And, there’s a chance that we might get some new leaks on his next podcast.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake has already released for both Xbox consoles and the Switch 2 on January 22, 2026, and hopefully, the port for FF7 Rebirth should be next on the list. At the moment, all we can do is wait for an official confirmation, but we do know the entire trilogy is making its way to Switch 2; it is just a matter of when now.

In other news, the director of Final Fantasy 7 Remake has stated that the FF6 Remake series should be led by someone else. Additionally, the game experience for the third instalment in the FF7 Remake series is “more or less complete“. When do you think Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth will be officially announced for Xbox and Switch 2 in 2026? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about a new leak revealing the Fortnite x Fall Guys Crown Jam mode. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: 8 Best Games To Play If You Like Hytale
item.content:encoded:
Hytale has recently launched in Early Access, and it’s fair to say it’s been a hit amongst fans and critics alike. Insider Gaming gave it a stellar first impressions review, and updates are already rolling out thick and fast.

However, as is the case with most Early Access titles, there’s only so much of Hytale to enjoy at the moment, with plenty of content gated behind ‘Work In Progress’ barriers. It’s no fault of the game itself, but if you’ve enjoyed your time in Hytale so far and are looking for something with a bit more meat on its bones, then you’re in luck.

Here are eight games that you should play if you like Hytale.

Minecraft

Let’s start with the obvious—Minecraft. It’s no secret that Hytale was heavily influenced by Minecraft; in fact, the creators began their development journey making mini-games and servers for it!

With that in mind, if you’ve somehow played Hytale and not Minecraft, you should definitely give it a go. Aside from the obvious blocky nature, it has an incredible amount of similarities. From a dangerous night time to vast biomes to explore, Minecraft is the sandbox that started it all.

Terraria

From looking at the image above, you might look at Terraria’s 2D art-style and wonder how it is at all similar to Hytale? Well, despite their dimensional differences, the core gameplay loops actually have a lot of similarities.

Terraria is filled to the brim with various monsters and bosses to fight, and the constant cycle of mining and getting better gear from rarer resources never gets dull. The game’s progression is as deep as its caves, and if you haven’t played Terraria before, they’re very deep indeed.

Vintage Story

Vintage Story is an incredibly underrated survival game that also shares a blocky aesthetic, but don’t let the similarities to Minecraft or Hytale fool you. It is a much more brutal take on the survival formula, so if you felt Hytale was too bright and charming, Vintage Story might be the one for you.

Stardew Valley

If you look at Stardew Valley for the first time, you might mistakenly take it for a simple farming simulator, but it’s so much more than that. Of course, the farming aspect does play a central role in the game, but there’s caving, fishing, romancing—it has it all!

There are hundreds of hours worth of content in Stardew Valley, so if you enjoyed the cosiness of Hytale but want something more long-term, then it might be time for you to open your first farm.

Valheim

If anything, despite its visual style, Hytale might just share the most in common with Valheim. Exploration is central to progression in Valheim, and you’ll need to travel across the world in search of more powerful resources, whilst also engaging with the various enemies and hazards that litter the land.

Although Valheim is also in Early Access, it’s much further along in development compared to Hytale, and there’s a ton of content to engage with. If you’re desperate to live out your Viking fantasies, then Valheim should be your next purchase.

Disney Dreamlight Valley

Disney Dreamlight Valley is a deceptively content-rich game full of stuff for you to unpack. It’s described as a hybrid between a life-sim and adventure game, and there aren’t many better ways to put it.

Whilst it does lack the survival elements of Hytale, it does instead feature similar base-building and adventuring aspects. If those are what you love about Hytale, and if you’ve got a strong affinity for Disney characters, then don’t sleep on Disney Dreamlight Valley.

Enshrouded

It’s another Early Access title, but Enshrouded needs to be on this list for its building systems alone. Some truly wondrous creations can be built, and it’s all so incredibly simple, but there’s a lot more to Enshrouded than just building.

Explore and survive in a vast open world filled with secrets to uncover and enemies to fight. It’s a hostile world, but thankfully, there are plenty of items and gear ready to craft. It might share more similarities with Valheim than Hytale, but it’s a best-in-class survival game that’s worth checking out.

Modded Minecraft

Okay, this final entry might be cheap, but give it a chance. If you’ve enjoyed Hytale but feel that Minecraft doesn’t quite scratch the same itch, then try modding it! Minecraft is one of the most popular games to mod, and some of them can genuinely reshape the game.

From building factories to exploring new dimensions, the possibilities are truly endless with modded Minecraft. Best yet, if you’re confused or uninterested in debugging a compatible mod list, then there are thousands of pre-curated modpacks ready to be installed and played in moments.

Do you have any other suggestions for similar games to Hytale? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Hytale content, check out where you can find dinosaurs, as well as how to obtain Mithril Ingots.

item.title: Echoes of Elysium Release Date & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
After a lengthy wait and a last-minute delay last month, Echoes of Elysium is finally poised to release in early access, with the release date and exact start times now confirmed.

The action-adventure RPG hands players their very own airship to customize and expand with crafting, weapons, and more, as you explore the world of Elysium, an environment full of mysteries to uncover.

If you’ve been anxiously waiting for the Echoes of Elysium release date, Insider Gaming has all the details on the exact start time, so you can work out exactly how many hours there are to wait.

When Does Echoes of Elysium Release?

Echoes of Elysium is set for release on Tuesday, January 27, bringing an end to the long wait fans have had to endure.

An initial early access release date was slated for December 4, before a last-minute announcement pushed the release date back to the above date.

The delay allowed the team to be “deeply focused on improving stability and overall game feel,” and was about “addressing real issues” so that when players jump in, the “experience is solid, reliable, and ready to grow.”

Tweaks include crash resolving and smoothing out rough systems, as well as porting the game entirely to a new version of Unity. The result is a build that is “significantly more stable” and “in a far better position,” so the delay has been worth the wait.

What Time Does Echoes of Elysium Release?

Echoes of Elysium will be available worldwide from 10 AM PT on January 27, with a simultaneous release for players across the world.

Details of the start time come from SteamDB and show that the time of day will vary depending on where you are in the world, with players in some regions only seeing the doors open for them to play in the early hours of January 28.

The table below shows the exact start time and release date for major time zones across the world.

Are you excited for the launch of Echoes of Elysium? Share your thoughts on the game in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, find out all the platform details for Arknights: Endfield, and check out everything coming to Battlefield 6 in the January 27 update.

item.title: Is Arknights: Endfield on Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
A new gacha-RPG title is spinning onto the scene with the release of Arknights: Endfield, and a customary question to ask with every release is whether the title will be available with an Xbox Game Pass subscription.

Arknights: Endfield releases on January 22, expanding the Arknights universe on the back of the original game, which was released in China in May 2019 and in other countries in January 2020.

If you were a fan of that title and are keen to jump into Arknights: Endfield, Insider Gaming has all the details on whether the title is available with a Game Pass subscription.

Is Arknights: Endfield on Xbox Game Pass?

No, Arknights: Endfield is not available on Xbox Game Pass, and it isn’t available on Xbox Series X|S at all.

However, that doesn’t close the door entirely to Game Pass fans as, while it isn’t available on the service, Arknights: Endfield is available on PC, and it’s a free-to-play game, so you don’t need to splash out any additional funds to enjoy it.

While it won’t be available through Game Pass specifically, PC players can still enjoy it. Unfortunately, there’s no similar news for Xbox Series X|S players, as there is no indication the game will arrive on the console.

That might be frustrating for Xbox Series X|S players, particularly as Arknights: Endfield is available on PlayStation 5.

Will Arknights: Endfield be Added to Xbox Game Pass?

It is unlikely that Arknights: Endfield will be added to the Xbox Game Pass service, as the free-to-play approach means it’s not necessary.

Recent updates to the Xbox app on PC make it easy to launch games across different launchers, so putting the title on Game Pass wouldn’t make much difference, and, due to the free-to-play nature, there’s no need to add Arknights: Endfield to the service if a console release on Xbox Series X|S occurs later down the line.

Free games have been added to Game Pass in the past, however, often providing additional in-game bonuses, so this is a route that could appear in the future. For now, though, there is no indication that Arknights: Endfield will be available on Game Pass anytime soon.

What platform will you be playing Arknights: Endfield on? Share your plans in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Arknights: Endfield, check out all of the active codes to redeem for free rewards, and find out the exact start time for the title.
